alert.note: Alert for Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 01 at 7:45PM MST until March 03 at 12:32PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Heavy rain may lead to significant rises on rivers, field flooding, and the heightened potential for rock slides in steep terrain. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai, Latah and Shoshone. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Field flooding may occur in areas of poor drainage. There is also a heightened potential for rock and mudslides in steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rain will occur through Wednesday morning. Melting snow will also contribute to runoff the next couple of days. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor forecasts and river levels. Be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
